alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 09 at 1:48PM MST until March 10 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Periods of snow continuing through tonight. Additional accumulations less than one inch. Dangerous wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Much of southeast Wyoming into the northern Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel may remain hazardous due to to icy roadways and reduced visibilities in snow showers. Dangerously low wind chills can lead to frostbite in 15 minutes or less if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
